refnamediv.refpurpose: Used to create, change, retrieve, or view attributes of database objects.

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: Used to create, change, retrieve, or view attributes of database objects. The arguments for "set" and "append" subcommands are attribute name/value pairs. The arguments for "get," "rm," and "show" subcommands are attribute names. The arguments for the "sort" subcommand sets the sort type for the attributes of the object: 'case' (default), 'nocase', 'value', and 'value-nocase'. The "append" subcommand appends the provided value to an existing attribute, or creates a new attribute if it does not already exist. The "get" subcommand retrieves and displays the specified attributes. The "rm" subcommand deletes the specified attributes. The "show" subcommand does a "get" and displays the results in a user readable format. Note that the attribute names may not contain embedded white space, and if attribute values contain embedded white space, they must be surrounded by {} or double quotes.

refsection.title: EXAMPLES
refsection.para: The examples demonstrate the use of the attr command and subcommands to assign and list attributes of database objects.

example.title: Assigns an attribute to an object.

listitem.para: Assigns an attribute name "material_id" to region_1. Its value is 10.

example.title: Assigns an attribute (with embedded white space in its value) to an object.

term.userinput: attr set region_1 comment {This is a comment for region_1}

listitem.para: Assigns an attribute named "comment" to region_1. Its value is "This is a comment for region_1."
